meanings.definition: The set of observable characteristics of an individual resulting from the interaction of its genotype with the environment.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the phenotype of the plant to understand how it adapted to different climates.
meanings.sent2: Her phenotype included her eye color, height, and hair texture.
meanings.sent3: The phenotype of the chameleon made it look like a leaf, fooling its predators.
meanings.sent4: His artistic phenotype shone through in every brushstroke, reflecting his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The phenotype of the flower was so vibrant that it attracted many bees for pollination.

meanings.definition: The physical appearance or biochemical characteristic of an organism as a result of the interaction of its genotype and environment.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper noted the phenotype of the tiger, admiring its stripes and powerful build.
meanings.sent2: The phenotype of the bacteria under the microscope revealed interesting patterns.
meanings.sent3: The phenotype of the fruit fly was so unique that it became the talk of the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her phenotype was like a canvas, showing the intricate blend of her genetic makeup and surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The phenotype of the tree frog allowed it to blend perfectly with the leaves, camouflaging from predators.
